title: Fernando Mendoza at No. 1 ... to the Jets? Reid predicts Round 1 in his midseason NFL mock draft
content: How many QBs could go in Round 1? How high might Rueben Bain Jr. go? Will the Buckeyes run Day 1? Let's project the first 32 picks for April.

title: Yamamoto follows Snell with rare feat in L.A. win
content: Yoshinobu Yamamoto pitched a three-hitter for the first postseason complete game in eight years as the Dodgers beat Milwaukee 5-1 to extend their lead in the NLCS.

title: McIlroy aspires to be Ryder Cup captain one day
content: Golf star Rory McIlroy says he "would love to be" captain of the European Ryder Cup team some day, just not until sometime in "the mid-2030's."

title: Calipari: Will retire before becoming 'transactional'
content: John Calipari has no plans to leave college basketball but said if he can no longer build relationships with players and do the job the way he wants, he'll exit the sport.

title: Trump threatens to remove WC games from Boston
content: President Donald Trump threatened on Tuesday to revoke Boston's World Cup matches if local authorities don't get tougher on crime.

title: Former USWNT star Press announces retirement
content: Two-time World Cup champion Christen Press announced on Wednesday that she will retire from professional soccer at the end of the 2025 NWSL season.

title: Rangers first to be shut out in first 3 home games
content: Mika Zibanejad was at a loss for words after he and the Rangers made history by becoming the first team in NHL history to get shut out in each of its first three home games of the season.

title: Sources: USC, U-M question Big Ten capital deal
content: Trustees at Michigan and USC questioned the Big Ten's proposed $2 billion-plus private capital deal, with one sticking point being it doesn't address the root issue -- soaring costs -- that has made the need for cash so imperative.

title: 📉 Bottom 10: Franklin's last act at Penn State
content: After a stunning free fall, Penn State's coach is out of a job but still has a spot on our list of outcasts.

title: NFL buzz for Week 7: What we're hearing on the Eagles' offense, 49ers' injuries, Titans' coaching change
content: Are the Eagles worried about their offense? What's next for the Titans after firing Brian Callahan? And could the 49ers be active at the trade deadline?

title: Family seeks justice for man wrongly accused in KC Chiefs parade shooting
content: Denton Loudermill Jr.'s life spiraled after photos on social media claimed he was the Super Bowl parade gunman.

title: Cooper Flagg put the league on notice before he ever played an NBA game
content: Flagg's NBA coming out party was last summer as he nearly upset Team USA ahead of the Paris Olympics.

title: Which WNBA free agents might be on the move for 2026 season?
content: In a pivotal WNBA offseason, a new CBA is being negotiated and there's an unprecedented number of free agents.

title: Ranking every championship team: 2023 Aces are No. 1
content: Las Vegas' 2023 title team topped our rankings two years ago. Where do the 2025 Aces and 2024 Liberty fit in?

title: The legacy and legality of the Bush Push 20 years later
content: When Reggie Bush shoved Matt Leinart into the end zone, it saved USC's season and ignited a debate that still lingers.

title: Our debut NFL rookie rankings: Three Giants in the top 10, plus big questions about the class
content: Who are the NFL's best rookies through Week 6? Which first-years are overperforming or underperforming? Here's our top 10 list.

title: Initial ALCS, NLCS impressions: Are Mariners and Dodgers World Series-bound?
content: Two games into both league championship series, we break down what we've seen -- and where each matchup will go from here.

title: Judging the MLB playoffs: Team to beat, vibe check, and this October's top ace
content: We hand out verdicts on how real -- or not real -- the biggest storylines are of this postseason so far.

title: How Vlad Jr. and the Blue Jays bet on each other -- and won
content: Just when Guerrero seemed destined for free agency, Toronto made an offer he couldn't refuse. Now the Jays are in the ALCS.

title: Ranking the 88 national teams that could win the 2026 World Cup
content: There are 88 national teams that could win the FIFA World Cup next summer. With only three international breaks left before the tournament, we rank every team.

title: USMNT World Cup roster implications: Wright, Roldan make cases
content: Has Haji Wright guaranteed his World Cup spot? Jeff Carlisle and Joey Lynch take a look at the major talking points from the USMNT's 2-1 win over Australia.

title: Facts vs. Feelings: Don't be haunted by the ghosts of fantasy weeks past
content: Loza's thoughts on Dak Prescott, Travis Etienne Jr., Chuba Hubbard, Drake London, Rashee Rice, Matthew Golden and Harold Fannin Jr. populate this week's column.

title: Matchup rankings: Judkins among those with favorable opponents, Hurts not so much
content: Here are the most and least favorable for Week 7 at quarterback, running back, wide receiver and tight end.

title: What we learned about 14 NBA contenders this preseason
content: The NBA preseason wraps up on on Oct. 17. Here are the most noteworthy storylines from 14 of the league's most intriguing teams.

title: Warriors in the Finals? Lakers under .500?! We simulated the entire 2025-26 NBA season
content: ESPN analyst Kevin Pelton used simulation No. 620 to run through the NBA season from Opening Night to the Finals.

title: Best (and worst) offseason moves
content: Who has the strongest transfer and recruiting classes? Here are eight key developments that could shape 2025-26.

title: NHL Rank: From 1 to 100, who will be the best players in 2025-26?
content: Connor McDavid remains No. 1, but who lands after? Here's who the ESPN panel believes is best for this season.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do at midseason
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the playoff picture takes shape.

title: How 'Abbott Elementary' turned an all-time Kyle Schwarber performance into an episode
content: Abbott Elementary" continues to embrace Philadelphia sports culture, and its latest outing has the cast cheering on the Phillies.

title: Why Spain's player production line is the envy of the world
content: What's remarkable about Luis De La Fuente's Spain is that despite getting stripped of their elite talents, they keep winning and thrilling anyway.

title: Rocked by scandal, Portland Thorns aim to reclaim former glory under new ownership
content: Scandals and abuse allegations forced the Portland Thorns to find new owners, but decoupling from the Timbers organization has been a work in progress.

title: Divisional rankings: Jaron 'Boots' Ennis makes junior middleweight debut
content: Former unified welterweight champion scored a first-round TKO in his 154 pounds debut. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: How to ace your salary cap draft
content: Are you ready for your salary cap draft? Jim McCormick lays out helpful strategies and tactics you can use to ace draft day.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid eye Chelsea's Caicedo
content: Chelsea plan to offer midfielder Moisés Caicedo a new contract to ward off interest from Real Madrid. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Will extend full support to A.P. in securing UNESCO World Heritage Site tag for Gandikota Fort: INTACH chief
content: INTACH can assist the A.P. government in preparing the dossier, carrying out heritage mapping and providing guidance for technical documentation, all essential steps in the UNESCO nomination, says Ashok Singh Thakur

title: NDPP and NPF set for merger in Nagaland next week
content: The ruling NDPP, formed by NPF rebels in 2017, to reunite with its parent party; Assembly left without an Opposition

title: Prime Minister Modi to launch developmental projects worth ₹13,430 crore during his visit to Andhra Pradesh on October 16
content: They include power transmission, roads, railways, defence manufacturing, and petroleum and natural gas

title: Five UDF activists arrested in Perambra clash case
content: Raids were conducted in their houses on Wednesday morning following allegations that they  were involved in hurling explosives at the police during the protest on October 10

title: DSU polls on Calicut varsity campus cancelled
content: A five-member team formed to inquire into the alleged irregularities during the DSU election held on the university’s satellite campuses

title: Kerala may get AIIMS, but only after March 2026
content: The Finance Ministry advises the Health Ministry to include it in the next phase of the PMSSY, says RTI reply

title: Kerala High Court extends suspension of toll collection at Paliyekkara to Friday
content: Court says a decision will be taken based on the repairs carried out on the 65-km Edappally-Mannuthy NH 544 corridor

title: Industries Minister P. Rajeeve unveils Kerala’s ESG, export promotion and logistics policies
content: They are aimed at transforming the industries sector in the State by positioning it an attractive destination for sustainable initiatives.

title: Tejashwi Yadav, Vijay Sinha file nominations; Prashant Kishor opts out of Bihar polls
content: RJD leader seeks third term from Raghopur; Jan Suraaj chief says he will focus on campaigning for party candidates

title: Cabinet approves land title deeds in forest areas irrespective of building size
content: Under the Kerala Land Assignment Rules of 1993, those who have been in possession of forest land prior to 1977 are eligible to receive land titles with the approval of the Union government

title: Parakamani scam: BJP points to ‘discrepancies’ in previous TTD board’s decisions
content: The procedure adopted by the previous board under the chairmanship of Y.V. Subba Reddy in accepting landed properties as gift or donation and several other lapses need to be thoroughly probed, says party State spokesperson Bhanuprakash Reddy

title: BJP fields Aga Syed Mohsin for Budgam, and Devyani Rana for Nagrota in the upcoming Jammu and Kashmir bypolls
content: With growing differences between the NC and the Congress, the ruling coalition partners have not announced their candidates yet

title: Defence minister has approved 100% increase in financial assistance for ex-servicemen: MoD
content: “The revised rates take effect for applications submitted from November 1, 2025, onwards, with an annual financial implication of approximately ₹257 crore to be met from the Armed Forces Flag Day Fund,” the ministry statement said

title: Family budget survey to mitigate the impact of inflation on working-class households
content: The survey will provide a database for revising the State’s consumer price index based on the year-on-year inflation rate, says V. Sivankutty.

title: Karur stampede: TVK ignored warnings, party leader’s seven-hour delay led to overcrowding, CM Stalin tells Assembly
content: Mr. Stalin said a higher security deployment than what would normally be assigned to political meetings was in place.

title: Zubeen Garg death case: Lathi-charge outside Assam’s Baksa jail as protesters hurl stones at vehicles carrying five accused
content: Senior police officers camped in the area and security has been heightened in and around the jail premises

title: Number of Left Wing Extremism-affected districts reduced to three from six: Home Ministry
content: Only Bijapur, Sukma and Narayanpur in Chhattisgarh are the most affected districts by Left Wing Extremism (LWE), the Home Ministry said in a statement

title: Bike rider, others suffer burns as acid leaks from lorry in Kochi
content: Police state in FIR that the vehicle, allegedly carrying sulphuric acid, was driven in a reckless manner

title: Six odonate species discovered in Silent Valley
content: The three-day survey from October 10 recorded 83 species of odonates. The total number of odonate species in the national park has increased to 109

title: 53 held in Meerut Range crackdown on illegal firecracker storage ahead of Deepavali
content: During the operation, police recovered firecrackers and explosive materials worth several crores of rupees from various districts in the range

title: Daily Quiz: On A.P.J. Abdul Kalam
content: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam was born on this day in 1931. Here is a quiz on the scientist and former President of India

title: Collective effort between State, Centre brought Google to Andhra Pradesh: Nara Lokesh
content: Nara Lokesh said State had made several legislative amendments to facilitate this investment, while the Centre was actively considering tax incentives for investors

title: Kerala govt. gives administrative sanction to non-SEZ IT building in Infopark first phase
content: The 1.90-lakh-sq ft building will be funded through Infopark’s own resources and a bank term loan, says CMO. The estimated cost is ₹118.33 crore

title: EPFO rules change: Opposition claims salaried people being punished for government's 'mishandling of economy'
content: “It is clear that the Modi government is expecting a drastic rise in unemployment due to its terrible economic policies. These new rules locking people’s EPF are the signs of a panicked govt trying to prevent a run on the EPFO,” TMC MP Saket Gokhale said

title: ‘Pepper spray’ incident at Kerala school: Nine students, teacher hospitalised with inhalation injury
content: Police said a student found a spray can on a two-wheeler and, out of curiosity, tested it on the classroom floor. The running fan spread the spray, causing students and a nearby teacher to feel unwell and rush out

title: Government favours holding elections to local bodies in Karnataka: CM
content: CM Siddaramaiah says, not only the RSS, no organisation should hold programmes in schools or public parks

title: Chander Kunj Army Towers demolition: Bids to be invited for project management consultant
content: Apartment owners insist that proposed PMC should be an international firm with experience of having executed multiple projects valued at over ₹300 crore

title: Boulder from cliff damages bus near Coonoor during heavy rain
content: Officials stated that with heavy rains expected in the Nilgiris, that areas prone to landslips were being checked to ensure the safety of local residents.

title: BJP announces Jay Dholakia as candidate for Nuapada bypoll in Odisha
content: Jay Dholakia had joined the BJP last week. His late father, Rajendra Dholakia, was a senior BJD leader and a minister in Naveen Patnaik Government

title: Twenty seven Maoists surrender in Chhattisgarh’s Sukma
content: Among those who laid down their arms are 17 men and ten women and two were described as “hardcore” in a statement issued by the police.

title: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman visits Virupaksha temple at Hampi in Karnataka
content: She was accompanied by Lok Sabha member from Ballari E. Tukaram, her private secretary Anirudh Sravan, Deputy Commissioner Kavita S. Mannikeri, and Anegundi royal family descendant Sri Krishnadevaraya

title: Labour Minister Santosh Lad says around 1.30 crore labourers in unorganised sector will benefit from petrol and diesel cess in Karnataka
content: The Labour Department plans to distribute smart cards to 101 different varieties of labourers who are working in their hereditary professions

title: BJP repeats Babulal Soren as candidate for bypoll in Ghatsila Assembly seat
content: The seat has fallen vacant after the death of Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) MLA Ramdas Soren; in the 2024 Jharkhand assembly election, Ramdas had defeated Babulal with the margin of 22,446 votes

title: Apple lobbies India to change tax law seen hindering its expansion, sources say
content: Apple's contract manufacturers Foxconn and Tata have pumped in billions of dollars to open five plants, but millions of those expenses go into acquiring pricey machines for iPhone assembly

title: Senior Kerala CPI(M) leader G. Sudhakaran alleges Minister Saji Cherian conspired to expel him from party
content: Scathing attack comes in response to Cherian’s recent statement that Sudhakaran should go along with the party and not try to create problems for it

title: Self-sustainable science and tech ecosystem with larger participation by private sector need of the hour: Jitendra Singh
content: Union Minister inaugurates finale of golden jubilee celebrations of CSIR-National Institute for Interdisciplinary Science and Technology in Thiruvananthapuram

title: Watch: Jaisalmer Bus Fire: Jammed door trapped passengers
content: A private sleeper bus traveling from Jaisalmer to Jodhpur caught fire near Thaiyat village on October 14, killing at least 20 passengers and injuring 16 others. Eyewitnesses said many jumped to escape, while authorities continue investigating the cause.

title: Criticism won't help, stand by people in distress: Bengal CM Mamata
content: Mere criticism (of the State's relief and rescue measures) won't help in mitigating the miseries of people. One should stand by the affected physically and extend help, says Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee

title: Meet the AI chatbots replacing India's call centre workers
content: AI-powered systems are subsuming jobs done by headset-wearing graduates in technical support, customer care and data management

title: Ahead of Argentina’s football friendly in Kochi, shops around Kaloor stadium told to close for a month due to security protocol
content: Traders under Jawaharlal Nehru International Stadium Shop Owners Association hold meetings with Greater Cochin Development Authority, requesting that shutdown be reduced to a week. But request deemed non-negotiable

title: Five accused in Zubeen Garg's death in Assam remanded to judicial custody
content: The court, expressing concern for their safety, also ruled that they should be sent to a jail where there were fewer prisoners

title: Kerala school hijab row: St. Rita’s Public School resumes functioning, management rejects Education Minister’s claims
content: Principal says Minister V. Sivankutty made the remark that school authorities refused to permit Class 8 student to attend classes for wearing headscarf ‘without verifying facts’

title: Fireworks manufacturers’ associations in Sivakasi hail Supreme Court order lifting cracker ban in Delhi NCR
content: The top court on Wednesday (October 15, 2025) relaxed its earlier blanket prohibition and permitted the sale and use of green firecrackers in Delhi NCR, subject to stringent conditions

title: Bihar Assembly polls: JD(U) releases first list of 57 candidates; CM Nitish to start campaign from October 16
content: The second and final list of party candidates would possibly be released by October 17; Prashant Kishor not to contest poll

title: Watch: India sees decline in births and rising sex ratio concerns
content: India registered 2.52 crore births in 2023, around 2.32 lakh fewer than in 2022, according to the Vital Statistics of India report released on October 13, 2025.

title: 9 injured as powerful explosion rips through house in U.P.'s Sultanpur
content: Locals rushed to rescue the injured and took them to the community health centre in Jayasinhpur, from where those with severe burn injuries were referred to Sultanpur Medical College

title: Watch: US-India expert Ashley Tellis arrested over top-secret defence files
content: Ashley Tellis, 64, a leading U.S.-India relations expert and former National Security Council official under George W. Bush, was arrested at his Virginia home for unlawfully retaining over a thousand pages of classified defence documents.

title: Delhi HC protects Hrithik Roshan’s personality rights, directs removal of ‘objectionable posts’ on social media
content: Justice Manmeet Pritam Singh Arora said it was not passing any ex-parte directions, at the interim stage, for the removal of certain fan pages and said an order would be passed after hearing them

title: Jaisalmer bus fire: Jammed door trapped passengers; bodies being verified
content: At least 20 passengers were burnt alive, and 15 others sustained critical burn injuries after the private bus travelling to Jodhpur caught fire, barely 10 minutes after it left Jaisalmer

title: Sentiments of people honoured: Delhi CM on SC nod for green firecrackers
content: Rekha Gupta said Delhi government expresses its gratitude to the Supreme Court for permitting the use of green crackers in the national capital at the government’s special request

title: Af-Pak clashes: 48-hr ceasefire declared after deadly skirmishes - who asked for truce first?
content: Pakistan and Afghanistan have agreed to a 48-hour ceasefire starting Wednesday evening, following a week of deadly cross-border clashes. This truce, requested by the Afghan Taliban, aims to de-escalate tensions and facilitate dialogue. The agreement follows Pakistan's precision strikes in Kandahar and Kabul in retaliation for attacks that claimed the lives of 23 Pakistani soldiers.

title: Durgapur rape case: Victim's father apologises to 'mother-like' Mamata
content: The father of Durgapur gang rape victim has sought forgiveness from Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee after previously criticizing her remarks on women's safety. He described Banerjee as a "mother-like figure" and pleaded for her help in securing justice for his daughter, urging her to forgive any harsh words spoken earlier.

title: Maharashtra flags 152 MBBS aspirants: Fudged documents caught; seat blocking probed
content: Maharashtra’s CET Cell has launched a strict verification drive after uncovering discrepancies in documents submitted for NEET-UG 2025 Round-3 admissions. Following a TNN investigation that revealed candidates holding seats elsewhere reappearing in the state merit list, 152 students have been asked to re-upload original documents by October 16. The move aims to curb seat-blocking and restore credibility in medical admissions.

title: Is Virat Kohli leaving RCB and retiring from IPL? 'He will play his last match ... '
content: Virat Kohli's future with Royal Challengers Bangalore is secure. He has committed to playing for the franchise. Reports of him leaving are incorrect. Kohli has not signed a new commercial deal as he awaits potential changes in franchise ownership. He continues to be a key player for RCB and has promised to play his first and last match for Bengaluru.

title: Zoho founder planning a break; says: I am at risk of ...
content: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu is stepping back from external commitments to focus on coding, a move driven by his principle of practicing what he preaches.  Having transitioned to Chief Scientist, Vembu now dedicates 70% of his time to hands-on technical work, including patent filings. He aims to expedite the delivery of end-to-end encryption for Zoho's messaging platform, Arattai, ensuring user data remains solely on devices, reinforcing Zoho's commitment to customer data privacy.

title: Nations dropping out of Brics? Trump makes wild claim; at odds with India again
content: Donald Trump falsely claimed BRICS nations are withdrawing after he threatened tariffs on their exports if they challenged the US dollar. Despite Trump's assertions, BRICS has expanded to 20 members, with Saudi Arabia being the only country to demur. India is set to chair BRICS in 2026, prioritizing developing nations' concerns.

title: Shocking! No Rohit Sharma, no Virat Kohli: Pat Cummins reveals ODI XI
content: Australian captain Pat Cummins will be absent from the upcoming white-ball series against India due to injury. Mitchell Marsh will lead both the ODI and T20I squads. Cummins revealed his all-time India-Australia ODI XI. Mitchell Starc will spearhead the bowling attack in the ODI series. Marsh's recent form makes him a strong leader.

title: Af-Pak border clash: Dozens dead; Taliban captures tanks & outposts - new visuals emerge
content: Intense border clashes erupted between Afghanistan and Pakistan along border area, claiming 15 Afghan civilian lives and leaving many injured. Both nations reported inflicting damage on the other's military assets, including tanks, weapons and posts. This escalation follows recent reciprocal strikes and ongoing disputes over border security and alleged militant harboring.

title: Apple’s China plans: CEO Tim Cook gives an update; China is 'happy' with it
content: Apple plans to boost its investments in China. CEO Tim Cook met with the nation's industry minister to confirm the company's continued commitment. This move comes as other US firms express caution regarding China. Apple's shipments in China saw growth, driven by the iPhone 17 series. The tech giant is also exploring manufacturing shifts to India.

title: What were Ashley Tellis' views on India, US, and China?
content: In his much-discussed 2025 essay “India’s Great-Power Delusions” in Foreign Affairs, Tellis argued that India’s ambitions far exceed its capabilities. New Delhi, he wrote, aspires to become a pole in a multipolar world but remains constrained by slow economic growth, limited military capacity, and weak institutions.

title: India-US trade deal cose? Talks pick up pace; Delhi working on 'win-win' solution
content: India and the United States are engaged in extensive trade talks. Discussions are progressing at various levels with a focus on finding mutually beneficial outcomes. India's exports to the US are experiencing consistent growth. The Indian negotiating team is currently in the United States for further deliberations. Both nations are committed to achieving a positive resolution.

title: Virat Kohli stops security, gives fan the moment of a lifetime - Watch
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are set to return to international cricket for India's ODI series against Australia, commencing October 19. The duo, who last played in the Champions Trophy eight months ago, departed for Perth after Kohli shared a heartwarming moment with a young fan. The three-match series will also see Shubman Gill lead the ODI squad.

title: TCS layoffs: HR chief clarifies; ‘We are not chasing a target’
content: Tata Consultancy Services HR head Sudeep Kunnumal addressed layoff concerns. He clarified that TCS is not targeting job cuts but will evaluate all employees. The company has seen a 1% workforce reduction, with further evaluations planned for those who cannot be redeployed. Kunnumal also mentioned TCS's localized US workforce and adaptability to H-1B visa rule changes.

title: Ellie-Jean Coffey gets death threats after false India sacred lake video claim
content: Australian surfer Ellie-Jean Coffey is facing death threats after a video of her urinating off a boat in Western Australia was falsely shared as her defecating in a sacred Indian lake. The 30-year-old clarified the mix-up, stating she has never been to India and the incident occurred in the Aussie outback, not Udaipur.

title: US passports drop in 2025 Henley Index: Top 10 strongest passports revealed
content: The US passport has dropped to 12th place, its lowest ever, losing ground to Asian nations like Singapore and South Korea which now lead global travel freedom. This shift, driven by changing visa policies and growing Asian influence, means US citizens face more travel hurdles. European passports, meanwhile, continue to strengthen their international access.

title: Zubeen Garg case: Fans attack convoy taking accused to jail - watch
content: Violence erupted outside Baksa District Jail as five individuals accused in singer Zubeen Garg's death were transferred there. A crowd demanding justice for the late singer pelleted stones at the police convoy. The accused, including festival organizers and security personnel, were moved following court concerns for their safety.

title: Indian-origin US adviser held: Why he’s under scrutiny; what FBI found at his home
content: An Indian-origin scholar, identified as Tellis, has been detained by US authorities on charges of unlawfully retaining over 1,000 pages of classified national defense information. The documents, marked "SECRET" and "TOP SECRET," were discovered at his Virginia home. Authorities also allege Tellis met with Chinese officials multiple times.

title: 'JD(U) not run by Nitish': Tejashwi says 3 leaders 'bought by BJP' now in control - watch
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav alleged that the JD(U) is no longer controlled by Nitish Kumar, but by leaders "bought by the BJP." He claimed Lalan Singh, Sanjay Jha, and Vijay Choudhary have taken over and "destroyed Nitish Kumar." This comes as JD(U) announced its first list of 57 candidates for the Bihar Assembly elections, approved by Nitish Kumar.

title: Bihar polls: BJP mocks Kishor for not contesting; calls move sign of 'weakness'
content: The BJP has taken a jibe at Jan Suraaj Party founder Prashant Kishor, suggesting he has decided to withdraw from the Bihar assembly elections. BJP national spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla claimed Kishor, a businessman and former election campaigner, realised the ground situation is not in his favor.

title: 'Arey hero': Old meets new - Rohit Sharma greets new ODI captain Shubman Gill
content: A heartwarming video captured Rohit Sharma embracing Shubman Gill, his successor as ODI captain, ahead of India's upcoming series in Australia.  Virat Kohli and Shreyas Iyer also greeted Gill warmly.  Amidst speculation about Rohit and Kohli's ODI futures, Gautam Gambhir emphasized focusing on the present and their valuable experience for the Australian tour.

title: 'Vijay was 7 hrs late': Stalin blames TVK chief for congestion that led to Karur stampede
content: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin blamed crowd management and actor-politician Vijay for the Karur tragedy that killed 41. He highlighted the delay in Vijay's arrival, inadequate facilities, and organizers' refusal to halt the caravan against police advice, leading to severe congestion and deaths. The government has initiated investigations and compensation.

title: Simone Biles opens up on mental health struggles during Argentina trip
content: Gymnastics icon Simone Biles inspired young athletes in Buenos Aires, emphasizing the strength in seeking help for mental health struggles.  Having overcome her own "twisties," Biles shared that prioritizing mental well-being was key to her recent successes. Her visit included motivational talks and a clinic, leaving a lasting positive impact.

title: Jaisalmer bus tragedy: How vehicle bought 5 days ago became death trap
content: A private bus, recently converted to AC, erupted in flames near Jaisalmer, claiming 20 lives, including three children. A suspected short circuit in the AC system caused the rapid spread of fire, trapping passengers. Rescue efforts were hampered by intense heat. Investigations into the bus operator and modification are underway.

title: Rohit Sharma bows to 'king' Virat Kohli before hugging him - Watch
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are among the first Indian cricketers to depart for the ODI series against Australia. Joined by Shubman Gill and others, the team's departure saw a heartwarming reunion between the senior stars. Head coach Gautam Gambhir expressed hope for a successful tour for the veterans, emphasizing the importance of focusing on the present.

title: 'No winners in trade conflicts': China hits back at US; defends rare earths curbs
content: China has retorted to US President Trump's threat of halting cooking oil imports, stating trade conflicts benefit no one. This follows Beijing's suspension of US soybean purchases, which Trump called an "economically hostile act." The US was China's largest customer for used cooking oil last year, highlighting the significant trade ties at stake amidst escalating tensions.

title: ‘Mahabharat’ star Pankaj Dheer passes away at 68 after long battle with cancer
content: Veteran actor Pankaj Dheer, famous for playing Karna in 'Mahabharat', has sadly passed away at 68 after battling cancer. He was known for his strong acting in TV and movies. His son Nikitin Dheer and daughter-in-law Kratika Sengar are carrying on his acting tradition. Dheer's portrayal of Karna is truly unforgettable.

title: Danica Patrick sparks backlash over Trump praise and Gaza remarks
content: Former race car driver Danica Patrick lauded Donald Trump for brokering a historic Gaza peace deal, calling him the "best president we have ever had." She also criticized Trump's detractors and protesters, advocating for "peace through strength." Patrick's recent political engagement and outspoken views have garnered significant attention and sparked widespread discussion.

title: BCCI makes huge blunder, mixes up Sarfaraz Khan with brother Musheer Khan
content: The BCCI's Ranji Trophy 2025 season began with an embarrassing mix-up, mistakenly listing star batter Sarfaraz Khan as dismissed for a duck. The error, which saw his younger brother Musheer Khan actually get out, caused widespread confusion online before the scorecard was corrected. This incident highlighted human error's impact despite digital advancements.

title: KBC Junior contestant wins Rs 7.5L for answering a cricket question: Do you know the answer?
content: A recent Kaun Banega Crorepati episode featured a Rs 7.5 lakh question about a statue unveiling at Wankhede Stadium in August. The Mumbai Cricket Association honoured a legend of the sport for his significant contributions to cricket, adding to the stadium's rich history. This KBC question highlighted the cultural blend of cricket and entertainment in India.

title: Cryptocurrency rates today: Bitcoin steadies above $112k after brief dip
content: Bitcoin experienced a brief dip below $110,000 before recovering, signaling cautious market behavior. While Ethereum saw a slight increase, several other major cryptocurrencies declined. The overall market value decreased, influenced by US-China trade tensions and potential Fed rate cut hints amidst inflation concerns.

title: ‘Allowed only from Oct 18-21’: SC permits green crackers in Delhi-NCR for Diwali; sets time slots
content: The Supreme Court has permitted the use of green crackers in Delhi and NCR between October 15th and 25th, exclusively at designated locations for Diwali celebrations. Additionally, firecrackers can be burst for one hour in the morning (6-7 am) and two hours in the evening (8-10 pm) on Diwali day.

title: WTC standings shake-up: Pakistan move past India; end South Africa’s winning streak
content: Pakistan stunned world champions South Africa by 93 runs in the first Test, ending their 10-match winning streak. Noman Ali's spin wizardry, taking 10 wickets, and Shaheen Afridi's pace proved too much for the Proteas. This victory propels Pakistan to second in the World Test Championship standings.

title: Watch: Video of man begging inside Bengaluru metro goes viral
content: A video of a man begging inside a Namma Metro train has gone viral, showing him soliciting money in the last coach. Metro authorities confirmed that begging is strictly prohibited on their premises and stated that security personnel monitor such activities.

title: Diwali 2025: Festival calendar, dates, significance, and muhurat guide
content: Diwali, the festival of lights, symbolizes the victory of good over evil and knowledge over ignorance. Celebrated over five days starting October 18, 2025, it honors Lord Rama's return and Goddess Lakshmi's blessings. The main Lakshmi Puja occurs on October 20, with specific auspicious timings for prayers.

title: Gold rates today: Price reaches record high; touches Rs 1.27k/ 10 grams
content: Gold prices surged to a record Rs 1,27,500 per 10 grams on MCX, fueled by safe-haven demand amid geopolitical tensions and expectations of US rate cuts. Silver also climbed significantly. Global markets mirrored this trend, with spot gold nearing record highs. Investors are seeking stability as the US Fed signals a cautious approach to interest rates.

title: 5/4! Maharashtra reel vs Kerala in Ranji Trophy opener; disaster for Prithvi Shaw
content: Maharashtra endured a disastrous Ranji Trophy start against Kerala, plummeting to 5/4 early on. Debutant Prithvi Shaw was dismissed for a duck, adding to the team's woes. Despite a recovery led by Ruturaj Gaikwad and Jalaj Saxena, Maharashtra reached 81/5 at lunch, facing an uphill battle in their new season.

title: Why too much calcium can harm your heart: The truth doctors want you to know
content: Calcium is vital for strong bones, but too much from supplements may raise the risk of kidney stones and heart disease. Experts say it’s time to get calcium from food, not pills.

title: 'I will not contest Bihar polls': Prashant Kishor claims NDA in 'complete chaos'
content: Poll strategist-turned-politician Prashant Kishor will not contest the upcoming Bihar assembly polls, stating the decision was made for the "greater good" of his Jan Suraaj party.  He believes his absence will allow him to focus on organizational work, and remains confident of a significant electoral outcome, either a landslide victory or a substantial defeat.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 above 25,300; Sensex up around 600 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Wednesday. While Nifty50 was above 25,200, BSE Sensex was up almost 300 points.

title: Explainer: Why US may be ready for a trade deal with India now - thanks to China
content: The US is accelerating a trade deal with India to diversify supply chains away from China. This move aims to offer India tariff relief and secure critical inputs, with negotiators addressing familiar friction points in agriculture, digital trade, and intellectual property. Both nations are keen to boost bilateral trade significantly.

title: ‘Called anti-Sanatan’: Gwalior top cop chants ‘Jai Shri Ram’ amid lawyer clash
content: Gwalior witnessed a charged scene Monday evening as a lawyer and a senior police officer exchanged "Jai Shri Ram" slogans near Phoolbagh. Advocate Anil Mishra, leading a Sundar Kand recitation, clashed with DSP Hina Khan over prohibitory orders. Khan's surprising retort to Mishra's accusation of opposing Sanatan Dharma escalated the unusual confrontation, leaving onlookers astonished amidst heightened city security.

title: Women's World Cup: Psychology meets cricket - Pratika Rawal turns theory into runs
content: India's star opener Pratika Rawal masterfully blends her psychology degree with cricket, using self-observation and analysis to excel. Her consistent performance in the Women's ODI World Cup, marked by high scores and an impressive average, showcases her mental fortitude and analytical prowess, making her a standout player.

title: How 5 minutes of daily exercise can improve circulation and protect your heart
content: New research reveals that even five minutes of daily exercise can significantly lower blood pressure. A study found that replacing sedentary time with brief, intense activities like running or cycling reduced both systolic and diastolic readings. These small, consistent increases in movement are crucial for improving cardiovascular health and managing hypertension.

title: Silver shines in 2025! ETFs deliver 102% returns, outpaces gold & equities
content: Silver is 2025's top investment, soaring 102% with prices nearing Rs 1.8 lakh/kg. Analysts predict further gains to Rs 2.46 lakh, driven by green energy and tech demand, outperforming gold and equities. Supply shortages persist, with a projected 118 million-ounce deficit this year, underpinning its fundamental strength.

title: Astronomers Observe Rings Forming Around Icy Celestial Body Chiron
content: The rings of Saturn are among the wonders of our solar system, with a diameter of roughly 280,000 kilometres as they encircle the giant planet. But smaller celestial bodies in the solar system also boast ring systems that are impressive in their own.

title: Telangana Home Guard, Doctor Arrested For Rape, Illegal Abortion
content: Telangana Police have arrested a home guard and an RMP doctor in connection with the alleged rape and murder of a 29-year-old woman on Wednesday.

title: Carbon Dioxide In Atmosphere Up By Record Amount In 2024
content: The increase in the amount of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere last year was the highest ever recorded, the United Nations said, calling for urgent action to slash emissions.

title: Andhra Man Poisons 2 Minor Sons, Then Dies By Suicide
content: A 35-year-old man allegedly gave poison to his two minor sons before dying by suicide in Dr BR Ambedkar Konaseema district early Wednesday, police said.

title: Bengaluru Surgeon Accused Of Killing Wife, Arrested 6 Months Later
content: Six months after the death of his doctor wife, a husband and fellow doctor has been arrested for her alleged murder in Bengaluru.

title: Voter Slips, Ballot Papers In Braille For Visually-Impaired Voters In Bihar
content: Visually-impaired voters in Bihar will be provided dummy ballot papers and voter slips in Braille, the Election Commission said on Wednesday.

title: Syrian President To Ask Russia To Hand Over Assad During Visit: Report
content: Syrian interim president Ahmed al-Sharaa will ask Russia to hand over former ruler Bashar al-Assad during his first visit to Moscow.

title: Opinion: Opinion | When the Dragon Tightens Its Talons: China's New Techno-Mineral Manoeuvre
content: China's reigning position in the rare earth supply chain, nay, the critical minerals chain, is of alarming concern for all, including major western powers like the USA and developing economies like India.

title: Mumbai Man Charged In US For Sexually Abusing Woman On Marriage Promise
content: Police have registered a case against a Mumbai-based man doing PhD in the US for allegedly sexually abusing, threatening and causing physical harm to a 31-year-old woman also studying in that country on the false promise of marriage.

title: "Dearest Bhaiya": Mandhira Kapur Smith's Birthday Tribute For Sunjay Kapur
content: Mandhira Smith, one of Sunjay Kapur's two sisters alongside Superna Motwane, is a second-generation award-winning entrepreneur.

title: Video: Maharashtra Minister's Convoy Drives On Wrong Side Amid Jam, Commuters Fume
content: A video of Maharashtra Forest Minister and Palghar Guardian Minister Ganesh Naik's convoy travelling on the wrong side of the road to avoid a massive traffic jam on the Ghodbunder Road in Thane has surfaced on social media.

title: Indian CEOs' Confidence In Company Growth Rises, Even As World Worries
content: Confidence among chief executive officers (CEOs) in India in their own companies' growth prospects has climbed to 83 per cent, up from 68 per cent in 2024, a significant leap that outpaces CEOs globally.

title: 'Courage, Not Safety, Builds Empire': MamaEarth Co-Founder's Business Mantra
content: Rejection has been a constant companion on her entrepreneurial journey, Ghazal Alagh, the co-founder of Mamaearth's parent company Honasa Consumer Ltd, said, adding it has also taught her many lessons.

title: In Karur Stampede Discussion, Pre-Emptive Strike By MK Stalin, Then A Counter
content: In its first session after the Karur stampede, in which 41 people were killed, the Tamil Nadu Assembly saw Chief Minister MK Stalin trying to pre-empt attacks from the opposition but ending up facing some anyway.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Story Of RSS And Left: Why One Flourished, And Other Perished
content: Between Jyoti Basu's lost opportunity and Vajpayee's brief triumph lies the story of modern India - of one movement that adapted its faith to politics, and another that failed to adapt its politics to faith.

title: 'Treated Like Enemies': Pakistan's Trans Community Alleges Eviction From Homes
content: Leaders representing transgender individuals on Wednesday accused the police of forcibly removing members of their community from various districts in the province.

title: Engineering Student Raped In Kolkata, Classmate Arrested
content: A second-year student of a private engineering college in Kolkata was allegedly raped by her classmate, and the accused was arrested from the Anandapur area in the southern part of the city, police said.

title: In Haryana Twin Cop Suicide Case, Another Body Waits In Morgue
content: Haryana IPS officer Y Puran Kumar's body was cremated this afternoon, eight days after he shot himself dead. The post-mortem and the cremation were delayed after the IPS officer's family refused consent for the autopsy unless an FIR was registered

title: Tejashwi Yadav Files Nomination For Bihar Polls From Raghopur Assembly Seat
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday filed nomination papers from the Raghopur assembly seat, where he is aiming at a hat-trick.

title: Delhi's Air Quality 'Very Poor', 5 Stations Record AQI Above 300
content: The five monitoring stations in Delhi recorded air quality in the 'very poor' category on Wednesday, with AQI levels soaring above 300.

title: Passan: Jorge Polanco has the Mariners on the way to a Hollywood ending
content: Jorge Polanco hits a go-ahead home run in the fifth inning to put the Mariners on top 6-3 . the "Top Gun Anthem" is an epic ballad filled with soaring guitar notes and pick-me-up vibes . it's the perfect soundtrack for this Mariners run, which sees them up two games to none .

title: Source: Bregman set to opt out of Red Sox deal
content: the 31-year-old will opt out of his contract with the Boston Red Sox . he was praised for his leadership on a young team that lost in three games to the New York Yankees in the American League Wild Card Series . last offseason, he didn't find a home until spring training .

title: The race to the 2026 World Cup: 25 teams have qualified, 20 to go
content: all confederations are drawing to a close, but we're still a long way from discovering the full list of 45 nations that will join hosts United States , Mexico and Canada to make up the field of 48 . the final two rounds of the group stage were played, when we discovered the seven nations that joined Morocco and Tunisia, plus interconfederation playoff contenders .

title: From train rides to Reggie Bush: The best games in the USC-Notre Dame rivalry
content: Notre Dame-USC rivalry nationalized football in the mid-1920s . it was a massive game right from its origin . the Trojans and Fighting Irish will meet for the 96th time on saturday .

title: Opening night or late-season debuts? Key NBA superstar injury returns to watch for
content: a week away from opening tipoff for the 2025-26 season . a few familiar faces and some new ones ready to take the court starting Oct. 21 . leBron James is expected to sit out three to four weeks .

title: Bracketology: Finally, some qualitative data to add to the projections
content: the weekly in-season Bracketology will begin a week into the 2025-26 campaign, on Nov. 11 . the Cougars recently received a procedural advantage that could pay very substantial dividends in March .

title: NLCS Game 2 takeaways: Top moments and the hero of Dodgers' victory
content: los Angeles Dodgers beat the Milwaukee Brewers 2-0 in the NLCS . defending champs Yoshinobu Yamamoto delivered a complete-game gem . los Angeles' starting pitchers put up two runs in the second inning on Teoscar Hernandez .
